{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is about the management of a woman with infertility who has bilateral cornual block on hysterosalpingography. This suggests that there is some kind of blockage or obstruction in both fallopian tubes. The options provided are all related to fertility treatment, but some are more relevant than others. Tuboplasty and hydrotubation are procedures that aim to open up the blocked tubes, while in-vitro fertilization (IVF) bypasses the need for a functional tube altogether. Hysteroscopy and laparoscopy are surgical procedures that can help diagnose and treat fertility issues, but they may not directly address the issue of bilateral cornual block.

After considering these options, it seems most likely that tuboplasty would be the ideal management approach for this woman, as it targets the specific issue of bilateral fallopian tube blockage.", "answer_choice": "A"}
